channel.title: Help quick
channel.description:
Whoever solves this gets rep+ from and my friends... HURRY
A ferris wheel has a radius of 20m and makes one revolution every 24 minutes. There are two pillars that hold the ferris wheel in place at x meters above the ground. Each pillar intersects at the center of the ferris wheel and is equal distance from the ferris wheel. The pillars are on a slant and have an elevation of 54.14°. The distance between the bases of the pillars is 60m. In sine function notation create an equation that gives the rider's respected hight, h, from the ground at any time starting when the rider gets on the ride. (Round to one decimal place) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: Help quick
item.dc:creator: @blazerowns blazerowns
item.description:
@blazerowns wrote:

WHAT MATH ARE U IN GAWDD

Read full topic

item.title: Help quick
item.dc:creator: @dumbolder dumbolder
item.description:
@dumbolder wrote:

Probably waaay to late, but just in case:

h = 41.6-cos(t*15)*20 where t is time in minutes

or with a sine function: h = 41.6-sin(t*15+90)*20

Read full topic

item.description:
